checkpoint.name: Patient referred with referral slip
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A referral slip/ Discharge card is provided to patient when referred to another health care facility. Referral slip includes demographic details, History of woman, examination findings, management done , drugs administered, any procedure done, reason for referral, detail of referral center including whom to contact and signature of approving medical officer

checkpoint.name: Referral checklist & Referral in/ Out register is maintained all referred cases
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Referral check list is filled before referral to ensure all necessary steps have been taken for safe referral including advance communication, transport arrangement, accompanying care provider, referral slip , time taken for referral etc. regarding referral cases including demographics, date & time of admission, date & time of referral, diagnosis at referral and follow up of outcome is recorded in referral register

checkpoint.name: Follow-up of referral cases is done
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that labour room staff follow up of referred cases for timely arrival and appropriate care provided at higher center. Outcome and deficiencies if any should be recorded in referral out register.

checkpoint.name: Reason for referral is clearly stated and referral is authorized competent person (Gynaecologist or Medical Officer on duty)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Verify with referral records that reasons for referral were clearly mentioned and rational. Referral is authorized by Gynaecologist or Medical officer on duty after ascertaining that case can not be managed at the facility 
Labor room staff confirms the suitability of referral with higher centers to ascertain that case can be managed at higher center and will not require further referrals

checkpoint.name: Check for the writing, It comprehendible by the clinical staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify case sheets of sample basis

checkpoint.name: Every Medical advice and procedure is accompanied with date , time and signature
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify case sheets of sample basis

checkpoint.name: Check Nursing staff is aware 7 Rs of Medication and follows them
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of medicines done after ensuring right patient, right drugs , right route, right time, Right dose , Right Reason and Right Documentation

checkpoint.name: Drugs are checked for expiry and other inconsistency before administration
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for any open single dose vial with left over content intended to be used later on.In multi dose vial needle is not left in the septum

checkpoint.name: Any adverse drug reaction is recorded and reported
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if adverse drug reaction form is available in labour room and reporting is in practice

checkpoint.name: High alert drugs available in department are identified
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check high alert drugs such as Magsulf, Oxytocin, Carbopost, Adrenaline are identified in the labour room

checkpoint.name: Maximum dose of high alert drugs are defined and communicated & there is process to ensure that right doses of high alert drugs are only given
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Value for maximum doses as per age, weight and diagnosis are available with nursing station and doctor. A system of independent double check before administration, Error prone medical abbreviations are avoided

checkpoint.name: Physical Examination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Recording of Vitals , shape & Size of abdomen , presence of scars, foetal lie and presentation. & vaginal examination

checkpoint.name: Rapid Initial assessment of Pregnant Women to identify complication and Prioritize care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Recording of vitals and FHR. immediate sign if following danger sign are present - difficulty in breathing, fever, sever abdominal pain, Convulsion or unconsciousness, Severe headache or blurred vision

checkpoint.name: Recording of current labour details
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Time of start, frequency of contractions, time of bag of water leaking, colour and smell of fluid and baby movement

checkpoint.name: Recording and reporting of Clinical History
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Recording of women obstetric History including
LMP and EDD Parity, Gravid status, h/o CS, Live birth, Still Birth, Medical History (TB, Heart diseases, STD etc) HIV status and Surgical History

checkpoint.name: There is fixed schedule for reassessment of Pregnant women as per standard protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is fix schedule of reassessment as per protocols. Assessment finding should be recorded in partograph

checkpoint.name: Nursing station is provided with the critical value of different test
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for list of critical values is available at nursing station

checkpoint.name: High Risk Pregnancy cases are identified and kept in intensive monitoring
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: List of cases identified as High Risk is available with labour room staff . Check for the frequency of observation: Ist stage :half an hour and 2nd stage: every 5 min

checkpoint.name: Vulnerable patients are identified and measures are taken to protect them from any harm
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the measure taken to prevent new born theft, sweeping and baby fall

checkpoint.name: Baby note is adequate
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Did baby cry, Essential new born care, resuscitation if any, Sex, weight, time of initiation of breast feed, birth doses, congenital anomaly if any.

checkpoint.name: Delivery note is adequate
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Outcome of delivery, date and time, gestation age, delivery conducted by, type of delivery, complication if any ,indication of intervention, date and time of transfer, cause of death etc

checkpoint.name: Registers and records are maintained as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Labour room register, OT register, MTP register, Maternal death register and records, lab register, referral in /out register, internal & PPIUD register , NBCC register, handover register

checkpoint.name: All register/records are identified and numbered
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check records are numbered and labelled legibily

checkpoint.name: Standard Formats are available
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Availability of standardized labour room case sheets including partograph and safe Birthing checklist

checkpoint.name: Treatment prescribed in nursing records
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Medication order, treatment plan, lab investigation are recoded adequately

checkpoint.name: Progress of labour is recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Partograph

checkpoint.name: Protocol of blood transfusion is monitored & regulated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: blood is kept on room temperature (28 degree C) before transfusion. Blood transfusion is monitored and regulated by qualified person

checkpoint.name: Allows spontaneous delivery of head
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: By flexing the head and giving perineal support

checkpoint.name: Unnecessary augmentation and induction of labour is not done using uterotonics
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check uterotonics such as oxytocin and mesoperstol is not used for routine induction normal labour unless clear medical indication and the expected
benefits outweigh the potential harms
Outpatient induction of labour is not done

checkpoint.name: Check no unneccessary episiotomy performed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with records and interview with staff if they are still practicing routine episiotomy.

checkpoint.name: Ensures 'six cleans' are followed during delivery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ensures 'six cleans' are followed during delivery 
Clean hands, Clean Surface, clean blade, clean cord tie, clean towel & clean cloth to wrap mother

checkpoint.name: Delivery of shoulders and Neck
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Manages cord round the neck; assists delivery of shoulders and body; delivers baby on mother's abdomen

checkpoint.name: Orientation session and information is available for Birth companion
Women are encouraged and counselled for allowing birth companion of their choice
Correctly estimates gestational age to confirm that labour is preterm
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Assessment and evaluation to confirm gestational age, administration of corticosteroid and tocolytoics for 24-34 weeks
Magnesium sulphate given to preterm labour < 32 weeks

checkpoint.name: administers antenatal corticosteroids in pre term labour and conditions leading to pre term delivery (24-34 weeks);
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review case records

checkpoint.name: identifies conditions that may lead to preterm birth
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: (severe PE/E, APH, PPROM);

checkpoint.name: Wipes the baby with a clean pre-warmed towel and wraps baby in second pre-warmed towel;
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: Records birth weight and gives injection vitamin K
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: Performs delayed cord clamping and cutting (1-3 min);
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: Initiates breast-feeding soon after birth
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: Identifies PPH
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Assessment of bleeding (PPH if >500 ml or > 1 pad soaked in 5 Minutes or any bleeding sufficient to cause signs of hypovolemia in patient.

checkpoint.name: Management of Retained Placenta
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of another dose of Oxytocin 20IU in 500 ml of RL at 40-60 drops/min an attempt to deliver placenta with repeat controlled cord traction. If this fails performs manual removal of Placenta

checkpoint.name: Checks uterine tone and bleeding PV regularly
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: Manages PPH as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: starts IV fluids, manages shock if present, gives uterotonic, identifies causes, performs cause specific management.

checkpoint.name: Staff knows the use of oxytocin for Management of PPH
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Initial Dose: Infuse 20 IU in 1 L NS/RL at 60 drops per minute
Continuing dose: Infuse 20 IU in 1 L NS/RL at 40 drops per minute
Maximum Dose: Not more than 3 L of IV fluids containing oxytocin

checkpoint.name: Provides syrup Nevirapine to newborns of HIV seropositive mothers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check case records and Interview of staff

checkpoint.name: Provides ART for seropositive mothers/ links with ART center
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check case records and Interview of staff

checkpoint.name: Rules out presence of second baby by palpating abdomen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence

checkpoint.name: Checks for completeness of placenta before discarding
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: After placenta expulsion , Checks Placenta & Membranes for Completeness

checkpoint.name: Use of Uterotonic Drugs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of 10 IU of oxytocin IM immediately after Birth . Check if there is practice of preloading the oxytocin inj for prompt administration after birth.

checkpoint.name: Uterine tone assessment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence

checkpoint.name: Control Cord Traction
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Only during Contraction

checkpoint.name: Facility staff adheres to standard protocol for resuscitating the newborn within 30 seconds.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Performs initial steps of resuscitation within 30 seconds: immediate cord cutting and PSSR at radiant warmer.

checkpoint.name: Facility staff adheres to standard protocol for taking appropriate actions if baby does not respond to bag and mask ventilation after golden minute.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: If baby still not breathing/ breathing well, continues ventilation with oxygen, calls or arranges for advanced help or referral.

checkpoint.name: Facility staff adheres to standard protocol for preforming bag and mask ventilation for 30 seconds if baby is still not breathing.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Initiates bag and mask ventilation using room air with 5 ventilator breaths and continues ventilation for next 30 seconds if baby still does not breathe.

checkpoint.name: Management of Obstructed Labour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Diagnosis obstructed labour based on data registered from the partograph, Re-hydrates the patient to maintain normal plasma volume, check vitals, gives broad spectrum antibiotics, perform bladder catheterization and takes blood for Hb & grouping, Decides on the mode of delivery as per the condition of mother and the baby

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of Indications for referring patient for to Surgical Intervention
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff how they identify slow progress of labour , How they interpret Partogram

checkpoint.name: Administers appropriate antibiotics to mother
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review case records

checkpoint.name: Records mother' s temperature at admission and assesses need for antibiotics
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review case records

checkpoint.name: Administers injection magnesium sulphate appropriately;
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: provides nursing care & ensures specialist attention.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name:
Records BP in every case
checks for proteinuria
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: identifies danger signs of severe PE and convulsions;
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check staff competence through demonstration or case observation

checkpoint.name: Patient Vitals are monitored and recorded periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for BP, pulse,temp,Respiratory rate FHR,dilation Uterine Contractions, blood loss any other vital required is monitored and recoded in case sheet

checkpoint.name: There is a process for ensuring the identification before any clinical procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Identification tags for mother and baby

checkpoint.name: There is a process to ensure the accuracy of verbal/telephonic orders
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verbal orders are rechecked before administration. Verbal orders are documented in the case sheet

checkpoint.name: Patient hand over is given during the change in the shift
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Nursing Handover register is maintained

checkpoint.name: Hand over is given bed side
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Handover is given during the shift change beside the pregnant women explaining the condition, care provided and any specific care if required

checkpoint.name: There is established criteria for shifting newborn to SNCU
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if criteria has been defined and in practice by labour room staff

checkpoint.name: Facilitates assisted feeding whenever required
Facilitates thermal management including kangaroo mother care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Facilitates thermal management including kangaroo mother care

checkpoint.name: Facilitates specialist care in newborn <1800 gm
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Facilitates specialist care in newborn <1800 gm (seen by paediatrician)

checkpoint.name: Staff counsels mother on vital issues
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Counsels on danger signs to mother at time of discharge; Counsels on post partum family planning to mother at discharge; Counsels on exclusive breast feeding to mother at discharge

checkpoint.name: Looks for signs of infection in mother and baby
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff Interview

checkpoint.name: Looks for signs of hypothermia in baby and provides appropriate care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Skin to skin contact with mother, regular monitoring and specialist attention as required

checkpoint.name: Performs detailed examination of mother
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for records of Uterine contraction, bleeding, temperature, B.P, pulse, Breast examination, (Nipple care, milk initiation), Check for perineal washes performed

checkpoint.name: Handwashing station is as per specification
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Availability of elbow operated taps & Hand washing sink is wide and deep enough to prevent splashing and retention of water

checkpoint.name: Availability of hand washing with running Water Facility at Point of Use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of wash basin near the point of use Ask to Open the tap. Ask Staff water supply is regular

checkpoint.name: Display of Hand washing Instruction at Point of Use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Prominently displayed above the hand washing facility , preferably in Local language

checkpoint.name: Availability of antiseptic soap with soap dish/ liquid antiseptic with dispenser.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability/ Ask staff if the supply is adequate and uninterrupted. Availability of Alcohol based Hand rub

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of when and how to hand wash
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask for demonstration of six steps & check staff awareness five moments of handwashing

checkpoint.name: Check Shaving is not done during part preparation/delivery cases
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff Interview

checkpoint.name: Availability & Use of Antiseptics
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: like before giving IM/IV injection, drawing blood, putting Intravenous and urinary catheter &Proper cleaning of perineal area before procedure with antisepsis

checkpoint.name: There is procedure for immunization & medical check up of the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hepatitis B, Tetanus Toxic .

checkpoint.name: Regular monitoring of infection control practices
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hand washing and infection control audits done at periodic intervals

checkpoint.name: Surface and environment samples are taken for microbiological surveillance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Swab are taken from infection prone surfaces such as delivery tables , door, handles, procedure lights etc.

checkpoint.name: Sterile gloves are available at labour room
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if staff is using PPEs
Ask staff if they have adequate supply 
Verify with the stock / Expenditure register

checkpoint.name: Availability of disposable gown/ Apron
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if staff is using PPEs
Ask staff if they have adequate supply 
Verify with the stock / Expenditure register

checkpoint.name: Heavy duty gloves and gum boots for housekeeping staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if staff is using PPEs
Ask staff if they have adequate supply 
Verify with the stock / Expenditure register

checkpoint.name: Use of elbow length gloves for obstetrical purpose
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if staff is using PPEs
Ask staff if they have adequate supply 
Verify with the stock / Expenditure register

checkpoint.name: Availability of Masks , caps and protective eye cover
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if staff is using PPEs
Ask staff if they have adequate supply 
Verify with the stock / Expenditure register

checkpoint.name: Personal protective kit for delivering HIV cases
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cap & Mask, protective Eye cover, Disposable apron

checkpoint.name: Entry to the labour Room is only after change of shoes and wearing Mask & Cap
No reuse of disposable gloves, Masks, caps and aprons.
Facility layout ensures separation of routes for clean and dirty items
Availability of disinfectant & cleaning agents as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Chlorine solution, Glutaraldehyde, Hospital grade phenyl, disinfectant detergent solution

checkpoint.name: Standard practice of mopping and scrubbing are followed & three bucket system is followed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Unidirectional mopping from inside out. Cleaning protocols are available / displayed 
Cleaning equipment like broom are not used in patient care areas

checkpoint.name: Spill management protocols are implemented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: spill management kit staff training, protocol displayed

checkpoint.name: Cleaning of patient care area with detergent solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff is trained for preparing cleaning solution as per standard procedure

checkpoint.name: Availability of colour coded bins & Plastic bags at point of waste generation
Display of work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste
Segregation of infected plastic waste in red bin
Segregation of Anatomical and soiled waste in Yellow Bin
Check bins are not overfilled
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Bins should not be filled more than 2/3 of its capacity

checkpoint.name: Availability of functional needle cutters & puncture proof box
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: See if it has been used or just lying idle

checkpoint.name: Glass sharps are disposed in Blue coded Card box
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Includes used vials, slides and other broken infected glass

checkpoint.name: Availability of post exposure prophylaxis & Protcols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask if available. Where it is stored and who is in charge of that. Also check PEP issuance register 
Staff knows what to do in condition of needle stick injury

checkpoint.name: Equipment and instruments are sterilized after each use as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Autoclaving

checkpoint.name: There is a procedure to ensure the traceability of sterilized packs & their storage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Sterile packs are kept in clean, dust free, moist free environment.

checkpoint.name: Autoclaving of delivery kits is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about temperature, pressure and time. Ask staff about method, concentration and contact time required for chemical sterilization

checkpoint.name: Proper handling of Soiled and infected linen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No sorting ,Rinsing or sluicing at Point of use/ Patient care area

checkpoint.name: Cleaning of instruments
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cleaning is done with detergent and running water after use

checkpoint.name: Disinfection of operating & Procedure surfaces
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cleaning of delivery tables tops after each delivery with 2% carbolic acid

checkpoint.name: Quality circle has been formed in the Labour Room
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if quality circle formed and functional in the Labour Room

checkpoint.name: Action plan prepared
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: With details of action, responsibility, time line and Feedback mechanism.

checkpoint.name: Non Compliance are enumerated and recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check points having scores partial and Non Compliances are listed

checkpoint.name: Check correction & corrective actions are taken
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check actions have been taken to close the gap. Can be in form of Action taken report or Quality Improvement (PDCA) project report

checkpoint.name: Referral Audits are conducted on Monthly Basis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for records referral audit is being done on regular basis

checkpoint.name: Internal assessment is done at periodic interval
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for assessment records such as circular, assessment plan and filled checklists. Internal assessment should be done at least quarterly

checkpoint.name: Maternal Death Audits are conducted on Monthly Basis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for records maternal audit is being done on regular basis

checkpoint.name: Neonatal Death Audits are conducted on Monthly Basis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for records Neonatal audits is being done on regular basis

checkpoint.name: Check if SMART Quality Objectives have framed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check short term valid quality objectives have been framed addressing key quality issues in each department and cores services. Check if these objectives are Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant and Time Bound.

checkpoint.name: Check of staff is aware of Mission , Values, Quality Policy and objectives
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Interview with staff for their awareness. Check if Mission Statement, Core Values and Quality Policy is displayed prominently in local language at Key Points

checkpoint.name: clinical protocols for Intrapartum care and Management of obstetric emergency are Displayed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Clinical Protocols on AMSTL, Preparing Partograph, , PPH, Eclampsia, Infection control, Referral, Infection Control

checkpoint.name: Don'ts/ Harmful Activities are Displayed at labour Room
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
1. No routine enema
2. No routine shaving
3. No routine induction/augmentation of labour
4. No place for routine suctioning of the baby
5. No pulling of the baby. 
6. No routine episiotomy
7. No fundal pressure
8. No immediate cord cutting
9. No immediate bathing of the newborn
10. No routine resuscitation on warmer

checkpoint.name: Clinical protocols on Newborn Care are displayed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Clinical Protocols on Essential Newborn Care, New born resuscitation

checkpoint.name: Check Staff is aware of relevant part of SOPs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Interview labour room staff for their awareness about content of SOPs

checkpoint.name: Standard operating procedure for department has been prepared and approved
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if SOPs available at labour room are formally approved

checkpoint.name: Current version of SOP are available with process owner
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check current version of SOP is available with all staff members of labour room

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for support services & facility management.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review the Labour Room SOPs for process description of support services such as equipment maintenance , calibration, housekeeping, security, storage and inventory management

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for specific processes to the department
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review Labour room SOPs for process of intrapartum care, management of complications, immediate postpartum care , Natural Birthing Process and Birth Companion

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for ensuring patients rights including consent, privacy, confidentiality & entitlement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review the Labour Room SOPs for description of processes pertaining to ensuring privacy, confidentiality, respectful maternity care and consent

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for safety & risk management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review the Labour Room SOPs for inclusion for processes to Physical as well as patient safety, assessment of risks and their timely mitigation

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for quality management & improvement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review Labour room SOPs for process description of function of quality circles, internal quality assessment, Quality improvement using PDCA cycle client satisfaction surveys, processes improvement , Maternal Death Audit, Newborn Death Audit, Referral Death Audit and Near Miss audits.

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for data collection, analysis & use for improvement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review Labour room SOPs for description of process related to collection of data & quality indicators , their analysis and use for quality improvement

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for infection control & bio medical waste management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review Labour room SOPs for process description of Hand Hygiene, personal protection, environmental cleaning, instrument sterilization, asepsis, Bio Medical Waste management , surveillance and monitoring of infection control practices, Periodic quality review such as Maternal Death Audit, Newborn Death Audit, Referral audit and Near miss audit.

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for general patient care processes
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Review Labour room SOPS for processes of triage, assessment, admission, identification of high risk patients, Referral , Medication management and maintenance of clinical records

checkpoint.name: Client satisfaction survey done on monthly basis
Analysis of low performing attributes of client feedback is done
Action plan prepared is prepared to address the areas of low satisfaction
Basic quality improvement method
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: PDCA & 5S

checkpoint.name: 7 basic tools of Quality
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Minimum 2 applicable tools are used in each department

checkpoint.name: There is system of daily round by matron/hospital manager/ hospital superintendent/ Hospital Manager/ Matron in charge for monitoring of services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Facility Incharge should visit at least twice in a week. OBG Incharge should visit Labour room atleast twice a day, Matron/Nursing supervisor should visit at once in each shift 
Findings/instructions during the visits are recorded

checkpoint.name: Departmental checklist are used for monitoring and quality assurance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Daily Checklist to check labour room preparedness and cleanliness is used for quality assurance 
Staff is designated for filling and monitoring of these checklists

checkpoint.name: Non value adding activities are identified
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Non value adding activities are wastes. In these steps resources are expended, delays occur, and no value is added to the service.

checkpoint.name: Process mapping of critical processes done
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Critical process are the ones where is some problem-delays, errors, cost, time, etc. and improvement will make our process effective and efficient.

checkpoint.name: Processes are improved & implemented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look for the improvements made in the critical process.

checkpoint.name: Check periodic assessment of medication and patient care safety risk is done using defined checklist periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the records. A comprehensive risk assessment of all clinical processes should be done using pre define criteria at least once in three month.

checkpoint.name:
Percentage of complicated
cases managed
Percentage of deliveries conducted at night

% PPIUCD inserted against
total number of normal delivery
No of drugs stock out in the month
Percentage of cases referred to OT

% of newborns required
resuscitation out of total live
births
No of cases pf maternal death related to Eclampsia/ PIH
No. of cases of Neonatal Sepsis
No of adverse events per thousand patients
Intrapartum stillbirth rate
Percentage of antenatal corticosteroid administration in case of preterm labour
OSCE Score
Percentage newborn breastfed within 1 hour of birth
The percentage of Women, administered Oxytocin, immediately after birth.
Percentage of deliveries conducted using safe birth checklist
No. of cases of Neonatal asphyxia
No. of cases of Maternal death related to APH/ PPH
Percentage of deliveries conducted using real time partograph
Client Satisfaction Score
Percentage of Deliveries attended by Birth Companion
